titleInfo.title: USA v. Gully
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER authorizing Michael Khalili, as a Criminal Justice Act Training Panel Member, to assist in the defense of defendant Jeremy Tyrell Gully. Mr. Khalili shall not be eligible to receive compensation for his services in this case. The Federal Public Defender shall continue to be primary counsel on behalf of the defendant Jeremy Tyrell Gully. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (GJG)[4:11-mj-03053-CRZ]

extension.docketText: ORDER - The appeal of the order denying review of detention (filing no. 36) is denied as to Jeremy Tyrell Gully (1). Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (AOA)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Gully
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 39 Motion to Continue Trial as to Jeremy Tyrell Gully (1). 3-day Jury Trial continued to 5/7/2012 at 09:00 AM before Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. The Lincoln courtroom that will be used for trials before Judge Kopf will be determined at a later date. The time between today's date and the anticipated trial is excluded for purposes of computing the limits under the Speedy Trial Act. See 18 U.S.C. 3161(h)(1). Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Gully
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding defendant's oral motion44 as to defendant Jeremy Tyrell Gully. Court appoints standby counsel to assist the defendant and the court in determining whether new counsel should be appointed to represent the defendant in this case. A hearing on the defense counsel's motion to withdraw, (filing no. 44), will be held before the undersigned on May 31, 2012 beginning at 10:00 a.m. The time between today's date and May 31, 2012, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (E-mailed to Karen Burks)(JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Gully
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 48 defendant's Motion to Continue as to Jeremy Tyrell Gully (1). The hearing on defense counsel's motion to withdraw, (filing no. 44) is continued to 6/8/2012 at 10:30 AM in Courtroom 2, Robert V. Denney Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, NE before Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. For the reasons set forth in the court's prior order, (filing no. 47), the time between today's date and June 8, 2012, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Gully
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Jeremy Tyrell Gully. It is ordered that:... (2)There were no objections or motions that require resolution at sentencing.(3)Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )
